synthesis_conditions.chemicals_used: Deuterated solvents from Cambridge Isotope Laboratory, other reagents from Aldrich, Acros, or Fisher
synthesis_conditions.comments: All solvents were dried before use according to standard procedures.

materials.material: Pseudorotaxane complexes with 4,4'-biphenyldicarboxylic acid and 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid derivatives

synthesis_conditions.temperature: 300 K for NMR studies, variable for temperature-dependent studies
synthesis_conditions.chemicals_used: 4,4'-biphenyldicarboxylic acid, 2,6-naphthalenedicarboxylic acid, triethylamine (TEA), deuterated trifluoroacetic acid (CF3COOD), AgNO3
synthesis_conditions.comments: The formation of pseudorotaxane complexes was monitored by 1H NMR spectroscopy. The complexes were sensitive to changes in temperature and pH.

synthesis_conditions.equipment: Thermo LTQ-XL linear ion trap mass spectrometer
synthesis_conditions.comments: The formation of the metal-linked polyrotaxane structure was confirmed by ESI-MS and single-crystal X-ray diffraction.
